intro: Isotropis, commonly known as the genus of flowering plants in the family Apiaceae, consists of several species characterized by their aromatic properties. These plants typically have compound leaves with a fern-like appearance and produce small, clustered flowers. The fruits are usually dry and schizocarpic, splitting into two one-seeded parts upon maturity. Isotropis species are often found in temperate regions and are valued for their medicinal and culinary uses. Their botanical features make them important in both traditional and modern herbal practices.
